org.apache.river.test.spec.jeri.mux.util

Class AbstractMuxTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.river.test.spec.jeri.mux.util.AbstractMuxTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LegacyTest, Test, TestEnvironment
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ClientAbortTest, ClientFlowControlTest, CloseTest, MuxClientTest, MuxServerTest, ServerAbortTest, ServerFlowControlTest

    public abstract class AbstractMuxTest
extends Object
implements LegacyTest
    Abstract utility class that serves as the base for all Jini ERI Multiplexing Protocol tests.

    • Method Detail

      • construct

        public Test construct(QAConfig config)
               throws UnknownHostException
        Description copied from interface: TestEnvironment
        Constructs a test and its environment. If an exception is thrown, the tearDown method will still be called.
        Specified by:
        construct in interface TestEnvironment
        Parameters:
        config - the test properties
        Returns:
        Test to run.
        Throws:
        UnknownHostException

      • tearDown

        public void tearDown()
        Description copied from interface: TestEnvironment
        Tears down any construct that was needed to run the test. This method is called even if construct throws an exception, and so must be designed to be tolerant of test state that is not completely initialized.
        Specified by:
        tearDown in interface TestEnvironment

      • getEndpoint

        public net.jini.jeri.Endpoint getEndpoint()
        Returns a client endpoint that uses net.jini.jeri.connection.ConnectionManager to manage its connections. This implies use of Jini ERI mux protocol.
        Returns:
        A client endpoint used in testing

      • getServerEndpoint

        public net.jini.jeri.ServerEndpoint getServerEndpoint()
        Returns a server endpoint that uses net.jini.jeri.connection.ConnectionManager to manage its connections. This implies use of the Jini ERI mux protocol. Certain tests expect the returned endpoint to be an instance of org.apache.river.test.spec.jeri.mux.util.TestServerEndoint.
        Returns:
        A server endpoint to use in testing

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Returns a port that a test can use when it needs to export an object. The next sequential port should be available as well. The port returned is the value of the org.apache.river.test.spec.jeri.mux.listenPort property or 9090 if this property is not set.
        Returns:
        A port on which the test can start a listen operation

      • getHost

        public String getHost()
        Returns the host on which the test is being run. All tests assume client and server reside on the same host.
        Returns:
        The host on which the test is being run

      • getTimeout

        public long getTimeout()
        Returns the timeout value that a test can use to wait for input to be received from a connection. The value returned is the value of the org.apache.river.test.spec.jeri.mux.timeout property if the property is set or 10000 is the property is not set.
        Returns:
        Timeout value to use in testing

      • getLogger

        public static Logger getLogger()
        Returns a logger named org.apache.river.test.spec.jeri.mux that can be used while executing a test.
        Returns:
        A logger for use in testing.
